meanings.sent1: She ran frenetically to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel moved frenetically around the tree, gathering nuts for winter.
meanings.sent3: The chef worked frenetically in the kitchen, trying to finish all the orders on time.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass frenetically as the deadline for the project approached.
meanings.sent5: The children played frenetically in the park, their laughter filling the air.

meanings.definition: Characterized by frenetic activity; fast-paced and energetic.
meanings.sent1: The frenetically paced music kept the audience on their feet.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were frenetically busy with people rushing to work.
meanings.sent3: The frenetically colored painting caught everyone's attention in the art gallery.
meanings.sent4: Her frenetically organized desk reflected her busy schedule.
meanings.sent5: The frenetically changing weather made it hard to plan outdoor activities.
